ygData.subject: Re: [cantera] Examples won't work for python
ygData.msgSnippet: You need to rebuild the Python extension module.  The build procedure for the Python extension module cannot always detect when a Cantera library file has

You need to rebuild the Python extension module.  The build procedure 
for the Python extension module cannot always detect when a Cantera 
library file has changed since it was last built. So when you typed 
"make"  after "cvs update" the library libcantera.a was changed but 
this was not detected by the procedure used to build the Python 
extension module _cantera.so, so it thought it was up to date and 
skipped rebuilding it.

Do this:

type 'touch Cantera/python/src/*.cpp'  to force recompiling and 
relinking, then type 'make python' followed by 'make install'.

If anyone is an expert with Python distutils, and knows how to specify 
library dependencies in the setup.py script so that this doesn't 
happen, let me know...




On Jun 17, 2004, at 11:38 AM, kvirgilm wrote:

> I checked out the code with cvs, ran make and install.
>
> Now the python examples won't work.  I get the following error.
>
> python mix1.py
> Traceback (most recent call last):
>   File "mix1.py", line 18, in ?
>     from Cantera import *
>   File "/usr/lib/python2.2/site-packages/Cantera/__init__.py", line 9, 
> in ?
>     from exceptions import *
>   File "/usr/lib/python2.2/site-packages/Cantera/exceptions.py", line 
> 5, in ?
>     import _cantera
> ImportError: /usr/lib/python2.2/site-packages/Cantera/_cantera.so:
> undefined symbol: _ZTVN7Cantera9PureFluidE
>
> Thanks,
>
> Karl
